required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pathological Comparisons of Surgical Open Lung Biopsies and Cryobiopsies in Non-IPF ILD
clinical_study.official_title: Le r√¥le de la Cryobiopsie Transbronchique Dans le Diagnostic Des Maladies Pulmoniares Interstitielles

brief_summary.textblock: Pathological comparisons of surgical open lung biopsies and cryobiopsies in non-IPF ILD. Patients with non-IPF ILD eligible for an open lung biopsy will undergo cryobiopsy in the same time. Between observers agreement will be assessed for each pairs of samples.

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of concordant diagnoses between cryobiopsy and surgical lung biopsy.
primary_outcome.time_frame: for statistical analysis, 12 months after the first inclusion
primary_outcome.description: The gold standard is the consensual diagnosis between the two readers established from surgical biopsy

secondary_outcome.measure: The percentage homology between diagnosis obtained by surgical biopsy and cryobiopsy with the multidisciplinary approach
The percentage homology intra and inter observer for histopathological analysis of each type of sample by Mac Nemar test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: for statistical analysis, 12 months after the first inclusion

secondary_outcome.measure: The number of elementary lesions actually present in the two samples for the same patient
The time of the gesture and the respective anesthetic complexities of each procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: for statistical analysis, 12 months after the first inclusion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non IPF ILD eligible for surgical lung biopsy reviewed during multidisciplinary approach
Exclusion Criteria:
- Ineligible for lung biopsy: pulmonary hypertension, coagulation deficiency, FEV<11, giant emphysematous bullae, hemodynamic instability severe hypoxia, general anesthetic ineligibility

reference.citation: Romagnoli M, Colby TV, Suehs CM, Vachier I, Molinari N, Bourdin A. Cryobiopsy Compared with Surgical Lung Biopsy in ILD: Reply to Maldonado et al., Froidure et al., Bendstrup et al., Agarwal et al., Richeldi et al., Rajchgot et al., and Quadrelli et al. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2019 Oct 1;200(7):944-946. doi: 10.1164/rccm.201906-1252LE.

Bourdin A, Suehs CM, Colby TV, Vachier I, Molinari N, Romagnoli M. Reply to Wand et al.: Role of Transbronchial Cryobiopsy in Interstitial Lung Diseases: An Ongoing Tale. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2020 Jan 15;201(2):260-261. doi: 10.1164/rccm.201909-1736LE.

Bourdin A, Romagnoli M, Gamez AS, Hireche K, Berthet JP, Mallet JP, Vachier I, Nava S, Reynaud P, Molinari N, Suehs C. Careful consideration of the bleeding caused by transbronchial lung cryobiopsies. Eur Respir J. 2020 May 21;55(5). pii: 1902415. doi: 10.1183/13993003.02415-2019. Print 2020 May.

results_reference.citation: Romagnoli M, Colby TV, Berthet JP, Gamez AS, Mallet JP, Serre I, Cancellieri A, Cavazza A, Solovei L, Dell'Amore A, Dolci G, Guerrieri A, Reynaud P, Bommart S, Zompatori M, Dalpiaz G, Nava S, Trisolini R, Suehs CM, Vachier I, Molinari N, Bourdin A. Poor Concordance between Sequential Transbronchial Lung Cryobiopsy and Surgical Lung Biopsy in the Diagnosis of Diffuse Interstitial Lung Diseases. Am J Respir Crit Care Med. 2019 May 15;199(10):1249-1256. doi: 10.1164/rccm.201810-1947OC.
